source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: whether I (you) make myself (yourself) or let myself (yourself) suffer cruelly [laisser…faire]—“cruelly,” a state of suffering, cruelty, remains

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: cruor, crudus, crudelitas: necessary history of spilled blood

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud’s Grausamkeit (w/out flow of blood): suffer just to suffer, torture/kill oneself, take psychic pleasure in evil for evil’s sake

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: for Nietzsche, cruelty is the cunning essence of life, w/out limit or opposable term, endless and w/out contrary

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: for Freud, endless too, but w/ contrary [?] [Eros?]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis allows to think: the suffering for the pleasure of it (just to, just for), the worst cruelty, suffer to suffer, making/letting oneself suffer

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: acc. Nietzsche & Freud, psychic cruelty always inventing new resources: cruelty of psyche, state of soul, still of the living, but a non-bloody cruelty [Grausamkeit]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Derrida doesn’t [:)] draw link btwn non-bloody cruelty & the Jewish joke about analyst who chose his profession because he didn’t like sight of blood [doesn’t want to reopen history of Judaism & potential universality of psychoanalysis]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis as another name for “w/out alibi”: questions radical evil or an even worse evil > only psychoanalytic revolution up to task of taking account of grammatical syntax, reflexivity: [“I you we made I you we suffer”]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: death drive (Todestrieb), cruel drive of destruction, annihilation, but also cruelty in Bemächtigungstrieb (drive for power, sovereignty, mastery)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “psychoanalysis” turned toward what is most proper to psychical cruelty, w/out alibi

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: possibility of a drive of cruelty is reduced/excluded by theological, genetic, physicalist, cognitivist, metaphysical discourses

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: confession of a “w/out alibi”—if that were possible

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: cruelty & sovereignty (very obscure things) pose a resistance to psychoanalysis, just as psychoanalysis resists them > this border (inside/outside) of psychoanalysis bears weight of our questions: historical, ethical, juridical, political

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “it’s not going well,” a redemptive concern—necessity to save: salutary, sanitary, immunitary concern > also, a gesture of war: militant saves by routing a resistance: French Revolution’s terror, Comité de Salut Public

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, Death Penalty, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, DP, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: always more than one revolution in a revolution

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: promise as threat—intolerable ambiguity for Speech Act Theory [promise en souffrance]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis’ native culture: European, Graeco-Abrahamic, liberal-bourgeois

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: grievances (complaints, demands) of psychoanalysis: internal (problem of its institutionalization & dispersion) and external (relations to state, society, mondialisation) > what is proper not proper to psychoanalysis re: these borders, who addresses the grievance to whom?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: death & technics > nonderivable, nonsecondary technics

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: threat of death, whose mourning/grievance would be born in advance, invades place left vacant for transferential destination

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “mad”: invent destination, address, addressee of grievance

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “mad” as a movement w/ no target, no telos, where movement of (counter-)transference has not yet taking place, is seeking its place, its subjects [is this an analytic site?]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: if psychoanalysis taught us one thing: beware autonomy, supposed freedom, alleged spontaneity

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “Why War (Warum Krieg)?” letters btwn Freud & Einstein, frontiers btwn phusis and psyche not well-defined: Einstein anticipates Freud (who is disillusioned)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Kant (said this better than anyone): no right w/out coercion

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: juridical decision approaches ideal of justice to extent that the community has at its disposal force of constraint to command respect for its ideal

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: pleasure/reality principle—same in differance > cruelty drive more ancient than principles?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: each psychoanalytic session, a micro-revolution, enfranchisement of regained spontaneity, freedom of speech, image/music of States General

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: arrivant, hospitality of visitation not invitation, beyond all instituting utterances, ce qui arrive, event, puts to rout performative act, sometimes cruelly, perhaps beyond the death drive, exceeds rules of hospitality: unpredictable for hosts

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: will theater of psychoanalysis always be royal family, patriarchal, heterosexual? will it always treat sexual difference as binary opposition?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: resistance of Arabo-Islamic culture, East Asia, to psychoanalysis (Judeo-Christian Greek?)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: [re: psychoanalysis] everything remains to be done, dissensus must remain a fortunate fate

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud to Jung: I am Moses, you are Joshua

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Derrida’s Socratic-like “I know nothing,” doesn’t know where to put his knowing nothing (who authorizes his questions?)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: these revenants must haunt our debates [Joshua Jung, Moses Freud] > cruel destiny of a proper name

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Derrida, advancing to a new theater of cruelty, wants to avoid alibis, will be very slow: prefers incorrigibly long [therapy] sessions [:)]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: death drive, origin of all cruelty—from sadism to primary masochism > this death drive sends reality/pleasure principles into crisis

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: who’s to say our republic is still not monarchical, that instead of a paregicide, the king’s neck was saved, erected by decapitation; never know if States General, at moment of first convocation, condemned or saved king’s head > both gestures indissociable

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: the who and what comes, the arrivant, makes outdated the question who or what has come? ——question of event/revolution always comes too late

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: 2+n bodies of the king

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis is ineradicable, its revolution is irreversible—yet, like civilization, it’s mortal

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: the who and the what of what arrives, the arrivant, the event, makes outdated in advance the question about it [event/revolution] that always comes too late

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis only “science” that intrinsically involves the proper name of its founder, a transferential filiation it claims to be able to analyze

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: survival, like some cruelty to oneself, always consists in enduring more than one death (and already during one’s lifetime)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: American hegemony at once obvious & more critical/vulnerable re: globalization, worldwide-ization underway

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis hasn’t yet treated DP, sovereignty in general, it needs to > otherwise, double resistance both of world to psychoanalysis & that of psychoanalysis to itself as to the world

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: U.S. in crisis w/ DP [?] (also, U.S. ostracizing Freudian psychoanalysis)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: an auto-nomy institutes itself on basis of a hetero-nomy that survives what survives it, on basis of the law of other, coming of the sur-viving other

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: to think institution of auto-nomy (egalitarian, democratic) as autoconvoked and not hetero-convoked is an abdication, political failing

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Derrida would like to ask “What is to be done?”—beyond all possible cruelty & sovereignty, w/out alibi, this question is not foreign to paregicide

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: king, authorized by God, Father of Christ

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: political force of psychoanalysis remains at odds w/ res publica, or even democracy of sovereignist concept (nation-statist), and at odds w/ publicity of its own institutionalization

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: secrecy delimits political authority [re: institution of psychoanalysis]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: all the worst cruelties and terrors coincide w/ invention of human rights: Paris Commune, French Revolution, Shoah…

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud: “paternal nucleus” hidden behind every divine figure

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: for Freud, cruelty, aggression > death drive turned outward, toward “objects”

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: think limit/horizon of psychoanalysis (yet to be thought)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: for Freud, force against force, deferred economy of force: makes right (passage from violence to law)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: must think a mutation of cruelty, more pscyhoanlaytico; new historical figures of an ageless cruelty, older than man

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: cruel mutation of cruelty: a technical, scientific, juridical, economic, ethical, political, and terrorist policing mutation of our age

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud: communism is an illusion, get rid of man’s aggressive inclination by guaranteeing satisfaction of all material needs

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: it is necessary to cultivate (it is necessary for an “it is necessary” to take shape: ethical/juridical/political obligation) an economy of detour & difference: strategy, path, pathbreaking, road, even a method > “indirect” way of combatting cruelty drive

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud on indirect methods to combat war, ruse of detour (Umweg)

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud advocates submitting life of drives to Diktatur der Vernunft, a Utopia > indirect stratagem of Eros/Thanatos: contrary to the cruelty drive, though cruelty knows no end

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: for Nietzsche & Freud, only differences of intensity, modality, quality, w/ in a same cruelty

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud’s indirection, oblique, angular, mediating nonstraightness: not just detour, strategic ruse, continuous transaction—but a leap, interruption, an ethical step

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: an outside psychoanalysis (ethics, politics) should account for psychoanalytic knowledge while maintaining heterogeneity of the leap [account for knowledge w/out seeking program]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: [<small>AT IT AGAIN</small>] what I name, what I call for: w/out alibi, w/ or w/out bliss, beyond possible, beyond horizon, beyond the beyond, beyond economy, appropriable, possible—beyond death drive wherever Freud reintegrated it in economy of possible, economic conditionality

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: beyond the beyond, not a sovereignty, not a principle

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: one cannot justify pacifism, right to life, setting out from an economy of life, can only be done on basis of a sur-vival that owes nothing to alibi of some mytho-theological beyond

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: numerous figures of the impossible: hospitality, forgiveness, gift—above all [?] the “perhaps,” the “what if,” the unpredictability of event

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: “I can,” “I may,” mastery of performative, dominates/neutralizes (in order of “symbolic,” symbolically) the event it produces

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: a task w/out horizon for a new psychoanalytic Enlightenment: will calculate w/ the inflexible unconditionality of the unconditional [think POOF, counting event of friendship]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: performative: power, possibility of “I may,” “I can,” or obligation, promise, law, sworn faith, the symbolic, all institutionality

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: constative: theoretical knowledge, neutral description, account of what is in fact, science

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: wherever there is law & performative, event has been neutralized, reappropriated by performative force or symbolic order

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: btwn performative institution and constative knowledge an absolute hiatus, absolute cut, structure of indirectness, hiatus like a mouth that speaks or wound that bleeds [cruor]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: this discontinuity calls for a leap, what Classical humanist philosophers call freedom, this interruption gives a chance

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: unconditional coming of other, its death or death itself, as irruption that routs performative/constative, perhaps beyond any cruelty

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: one rarely speaks of alibis w/out suspecting crime, nor crime w/out suspicion of cruelty

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: stranger [Derrida] speaks badly (mal) of evil, doesn’t believe in sovereign good or sovereign evil > he only suffers from it, but hopes to make it known

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: btwn killing/suicide: difference infinite & null [cf. DPi p. 249]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: cruelty there will have been, cruelty before any personal figure, before “cruelty” is an attribute—no one’s fault

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: is Derrida or the French language to blame for the untranslatable: avoir mal, faire mal, vouloir du mal, en vouloir à quelqu’un?

source.title: Psychoanalysis Searches the States of its Soul

content: Freud didn’t like America because he couldn’t stomach the food
